title: FAULT: Apple iMac Desktop - macOS Ventura 13.4.1 (c) will not add Firefox 15.0.2 (64bit) to the Open at Login list
content:
Also, iMac crashed and immediately restarted without a fault report while I was using Firefox today. Following instructions from the Apple Support Desk I have since Command "R" reloaded the Mac operating system (both normally and in Safe Mode) and the Firefox app as well but the issue persists. While it might be a minor issue (no auto-load) I am concerned there might be more serious underlying compatibility problems or system failures I have yet to experience. In contrast, my current macOS installation will add/delete Thunderbird (and couple of other apps I experimented with) on the auto start up list without any problem. The only recent macOS system change I think was to install an update to bring it up to Ventura 13.4.1 (c), from 13.4.1 I think.

The Apple Genius Desk at the Canberra store ran a complete hardware check which did not report any faults only a few days ago. In all other respects the iMac and apps "appear" to be running normally.

Any advice on rectifying the problem would be appreciated - e.g. a full Apple Store Reset/Reload of macOS followed by a fresh start with a complete reload of my current app collection as I am not all sure where the problem rests - with the macOS or the Firefox app, some incompatibility or a download corruption in either?
creator: Poppa

Maybe a month ago i changed a lot of passwords, saved them and synchronized with account using PC. Now, when I install Firefox and sign in to my account on my mobile, passwords (old versions) was send from my phone to the Firefox server and changes made on PC was overwritten by older versions from mobile. What's wrong with that?

For those unfamiliar with it, App Homie is a revolutionary application that is changing the way we play. This innovative platform offers a range of features that allows us to optimize our gaming experience like never before.

We will start by discussing how App Homie can enhance your gaming experience. From keeping us informed about the latest video game news, sharing tips and tricks, to organizing online tournaments with friends, the Homie app is truly our best friend in the world of video games.

In addition to being a hub for all things video game-related, App Homie also fosters an active and supportive community. It's a place where gamers from around the world can come together, discuss strategies, exchange opinions, and simply enjoy their love for video games.

In upcoming posts, we will delve into the use of App Homie, from basic setup to mastering its most advanced features. Additionally, we will also talk about how App Homie is impacting the video game industry and the emerging trends we are seeing.

We want this blog to be a useful resource and a meeting place for all of us who love video games and App Homie. So don't hesitate to share your thoughts, ideas, and experiences with us. We are eager to embark on this journey with you.

title: Have you come across Azure AD becoming Microsoft Entra?
content:
What is Microsoft Entra and its Features:

As you may have already gathered from the above descriptions of the Microsoft Entra components, Microsoft Entra is Microsoft’s solution to provide identity management, RBAC, and CIEM as a solution for all your identities.

Part of the functionality offered with Microsoft Entra comes from Microsoft’s acquisition of CloudKnox Security. It has now been reborn as Microsoft Entra Permissions Management. This solution, as part of Microsoft Entra allows discovering, remediating, and monitoring permission risks for any identity or resource across clouds.

This is the Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) platform Microsoft references with the features of Microsoft Entra. It allows organizations to have visibility and control over permissions for any identity and resources in:

Microsoft Azure Amazon Web Services (AWS) Google Cloud Platform (GCP) It will provide the following capabilities as part of the solution to manage identity across clouds:

  • Unified multi-cloud permissions management
  • Automated remediation
  • Anomaly detections and alerts
  • Detailed forensic reports
